sn3.16:1.2: Then King Pasenadi of Kosala went up to the Buddha, bowed, and sat down to one side.
sn3.16:1.3: Then a man went up to the king and whispered in his ear,
sn3.16:1.4: “Your Majesty, Queen Mallikā has given birth to a daughter.”
sn3.16:1.5: When this was said, King Pasenadi was disappointed.
sn3.16:2.1: Then, knowing that King Pasenadi was disappointed, on that occasion the Buddha recited these verses:
sn3.16:3.1: “Well, some women are better than men,
sn3.16:3.4: a devoted wife who honors her mother in law.
sn3.16:4.1: And when she has a son,
sn3.16:4.2: he becomes a hero, O lord of the land.
sn3.16:4.3: The son of such a blessed lady
